page.title: 15 CUSTOMS IN LITCHAM
page.content: There are a few organised customs in Litcham,but most people do family outings such as:family get togethers or feasts and picnics or lunches.The biggest public celebration is held on Guy Fawkes night.One of the big fields in the village is used and a bonfire is lit and later on fireworks are let off.Also on that day we eat jacket potatoes and soup.Some families have private bonfires or barbecues.At the old peoples home they dont have a bonfire but they celebrate at Christmas with a party.Many people go to family parties or discos with buffet at Christmas time.Other occasions celebrated are the main religous ceremonies like Harvest Festival.Everybody brings vegetables and they arranged around the font and then the service takes place.
